revised_title: Discovery of a Ninth Unique Influenza Virus-Coded Polypeptide
tldr: Researchers discovered a ninth unique polypeptide in influenza A and B viruses, distinct from the eight previously known virus-coded proteins. The polypeptide, with a molecular mass of around 11,000, is virus-specific and has a unique mRNA with an estimated size of 300-400 nucleotides. This finding expands our understanding of the structure and function of influenza viruses.
